business.headline: Muhurat trading guide: Timings, history, and what to expect on Diwali 2024Muhurat trading is a unique session conducted by Indian stock exchanges on Diwali, rooted in the belief that this 'auspicious hour' is a time to attract prosperity.
Sensex, Nifty jump on banking boost, end 5-day losing streakThe S&P BSE Sensex added 602.75 points to close at 80,005.04, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 158.35 points to close at 24,339.15.

Economic crisis forcing China to adjust foreign policy: Ian BremmerIan Bremmer explained why China is showing less willingness to engage in confrontational behaviour and is actively seeking to reduce tensions with key partners.

Afcons Infrastructure IPO: Day 2 subscription status, GMP. Subscribe or skip?The Afcons Infrastructure IPO comprises a fresh issue of 2.7 crore shares valued at Rs 1,250 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 9.03 crore shares worth Rs 4,180 crore.

Sensex rises 900 points. What's behind the stock market rally?Stock market update: The BSE Sensex climbed 827.37 points to 80,229.53, adding over Rs 3 lakh crore in market capitalisation. On the other hand, the Nifty50 rose 225.30 points to 24,406.10.

Waaree Energies share price falls 3% after bumper debut. Here's whyWaaree Energies listing: Shares of Waaree Energies opened at Rs 2,550, at a premium of 69.66% over its issue price of Rs 1,503 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

IndiGo share price tumbles over 10% after Q2 results. Buy, hold or sell? IndiGo share price: The shares crashed as much as 13% on Monday, reaching a low of Rs 3,778.50. At 10:54 am, shares of the company were trading 7.66% lower to Rs 4,030.35.

Waaree Energies shares make strong market debut with 70% premiumWaaree Energies share price: Shares of Waaree Energies opened at Rs 2,550, a premium of 69.66% over its issue price of Rs 1,503 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE)
Explained: Why IDFC First Bank shares fell 10% in early trade todayThe bank's stock has fallen by 25% year-to-date in 2024, with a current market capitalisation of Rs 49,034 crore.

Reliance share price showing 50% fall on trading apps today. Here's whyRIL share price: Reliance shares opened at Rs 1,338, which appeared to be 49.61% lower than Friday's closing price of Rs 2,655.45 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
Sensex, Nifty open in green led by a rally in financial and bank stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 902.40 points to 80,304.76, whiile the Nifty50 was up 251.35 points to 24,432.15.

Twist in JioHotstar drama, Dubai siblings claim they bought domain from developerThe JioHotstar.com controversy has taken a new turn as the Delhi developer, who bought the domain much to the annoyance of Reliance Industries, seems to have sold it to two Dubai-based children -- Jainam and Jivika.
ITR filing deadline for corporate taxpayers extended till November 15ITR filing deadline: The extension applies to taxpayers covered under sub-Section (1) of Section 139 of the Income-tax Act, 1961.

Waaree Energies IPO: GMP drops before listing; should investors worry?Waaree Energies listing expectations: With the company set to debut on October 28, Waaree Energies' GMP currently stands around Rs 1,320, reflecting a potential listing premium of 88% over the IPO issue price.

ED raids in Mumbai, Haryana against pharma company in Rs 220-crore fraud caseDuring the search operations in Mumbai and Haryana's Yamunanagar, movable assets including bank funds, Demat accounts valued at Rs 14.53 crore were seized or frozen.

Afcons Infrastructure IPO Day 1: Check latest subscription, GMP Afcons Infrastructure's IPO aims to raise Rs 5,430 crore and consists of a fresh issue of 2.7 crore shares, totalling Rs 1,250 crore, and an offer for sale of 9.03 crore shares, amounting to Rs 4,180 crore.

Sensex, Nifty continue losing streak amid ongoing FII exodus, dull Q2 earnings At the closing bell, the Sensex was down 662.87 points at 79,402.29, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 189.55 points lower at 24,209.85.

Waaree Energies IPO: Will it double your investment? Here's what experts sayWaaree Energies IPO attracted significant interest from investors and was subscribed 79.44 times by the end of the bidding process on October 23, 2024.

Sensex falls 800 points: Should investors buy the dip or hold back?Stock market bloodbath: This year's pre-Diwali period has been especially challenging for benchmark indices, with the Sensex and Nifty heading toward their steepest October decline since the Covid-driven crash in 2020.
Ratan Tata's estate worth Rs 10,000 crore: Who gets what in his will Ratan Tata died on October 9 in Mumbai and left a Rs 10,000 crore will, which includes provisions for his near and dear ones.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Why C295 aircraft project is a game changer for India. Know in 5 pointsThe C295 facility in Gujarat is the first private factory from which planes, ready to take to the skies, will be rolled out. From enhancing India's defence capabilities, creating jobs and positioning India as an exporter, the Tata-Airbus C295 project is a game changer.

Better than being actress's husband: Nawab Malik's daughter jabs NCP (SP) rivalSana Malik, a candidate from Ajit Pawar-led NCP, will take on actor Swara Bhaskar's husband Fahad Ahmad who joined the NCP faction led by Sharad Pawar.

Salman Khan checks on me every night after father's death: Zeeshan SiddiqueBollywood actor Salman Khan has regularly checked on Zeeshan Siddique following his father Baba Siddique's death. In a recent interview, Zeeshan revealed that Salman was very close to his father.

PM Modi reacts to El Clasico, talks Real Madrid vs Barcelona fandom in IndiaPrime Minister Narendra Modi hailed the rivalry between Real Madrid and FC Barcelona in his latest speech at Vadodra. Speaking about relations between India and Spain. PM Modi said that India also had a massive football culture.

How a split-second decision can save you from digital-arrest scamIn just four months of 2024, people in India have lost Rs 120 crore to a scam called digital arrest. Such widespread is the on-call fraud that PM Modi had to discuss it in his Mann Ki Baat speech. This is how a split-second decision can help save your life's savings from being drained.

Pappu Yadav gets Lawrence Bishnoi threat after 'main hoon na' post for Salman KhanIn response to Baba Siddique's murder, Pappu Yadav had openly challenged Lawrence Bishnoi, declaring that if allowed, he would dismantle the network of "a two-bit criminals like Lawrence Bishnoi" within 24 hours.

Maturity in system to not discuss cases: Chief Justice on 'PM at Ganpati puja' row Chief Justice DY Chandrachud said such meetings, like the one he had with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, are important to address judicial infrastructure, including new court buildings and accommodation for judges.

From one actor-politician to another: Pawan Kalyan hails Vijay's maiden rallyActor-turned-politician Pawan Kalyan congratulated Tamil actor Vijay on his debut political rally in Tamil Nadu. Vijay had announced his party in February this year.
Viral video: Cars, trucks in air after hitting Gurugram speed bumpA video of vehicles "flying" over an unmarked speed bump on a Gurugram road went viral on social media.

Elevating Your Career with IIM Kozhikode's Advanced Operations Analytics and Supply Chain Management ProgrammeElevate your career with IIM Kozhikode's comprehensive programme, designed to equip professionals with the latest tools and strategies in operations management and data analytics. Gain hands-on experience through live sessions, capstone projects, and industry-relevant assignments, while accessing the prestigious IIMK Executive Alumni network.

New kid on the block: Swara Bhasker wishes husband Fahad on poll debutFahad Ahmad, husband of actor Swara Bhasker, has been fielded from the Anushakti Nagar constituency, where he faces Sana Malik from the rival NCP faction led by Ajit Pawar.

Row over Delhi Waqf Board report, Chief Minister Atishi says it's 'null and void'Delhi Chief Minister Atishi said that the Delhi Waqf Board's report was submitted without the AAP government's approval and should be considered "null and void".
Noida woman in BMW steals flower pot kept outside shop. Video is viralThe footage showed the woman stepping out of her BMW X1 at night and stealing a flower pot placed outside the shop.

The Problem in Your Plate: Why an Indian home-cooked meal is not always healthyJust because food is homemade doesn't mean it's automatically healthy. Contrary to popular belief, home-cooked meals aren't always nutritious and can work against your health goals.

How Sharad Pawar used a feud, brought his NCP on par with CongressAmid tussle over seats between the Congress and Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena (UBT), Sharad Pawar managed 85 seats for his Nationalist Congress Party. His NCP, which had a good strike rate in 2024 Lok Sabha polls, now stands a real chance of getting own chief minister if the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) wins the Maharashtra election.
3 terrorists killed after attack on Army vehicle in J&K's Akhnoor, gunfight onSuspected terrorists fired at an Army vehicle in Jammu's Akhnoor sector and a search operation was launched subsequently.

Video: Did Orry do a spoof of awkward Jaya Bachchan-Sonali Bendre moment?Orry spoofed a viral and awkward video of Sonali Bendre and Jaya Bachchan from Ira Khan's wedding reception at a recent Diwali party. It is making the internet laugh out loud.

India-China border disengagement in final phase at 2 crucial Ladakh points: SourcesDays after a breakthrough in border talks with China, defence sources have confirmed that disengagement at Eastern Ladakh's Depsang and Demchok is in its final phase, with the first patrols set to resume by month's end.

Speaker Jaya Kishori trolled over Rs 2 lakh Dior bag: 'Practice what you preach'Spiritual preacher Jaya Kishori faced backlash online after a video of her carrying a Dior bag, priced at over Rs 2 lakh, went viral on social media.

Woman kills husband for refusing Rs 8 crore demand, dumps body 800 km awayThe victim's wife was earlier arrested in connection with financial fraud in Haryana. When her husband refused to give her Rs 8 crore, she took the help of Ankur, a man she met in jail, to kill her husband.

Indian scientists discover new planet. It's five times larger than EarthTOI-6651b is a unique exoplanet, weighing around 60 times the mass of Earth and having a radius approximately five times larger than Earth's.

How Maharana Pratap became Akbar's greatest unfinished conquestWhile Akbar compelled other Rajput rulers to submit, the Maharana of Mewar stood firm against him. The siege of Chittor failed to break Mewar's spirit, and the 1576 Battle of Haldighati resulted in heavy Mughal casualties. Maharana Pratap later reclaimed lost territories, and Akbar's ambition to annex Mewar remained unfulfilled until his death in 1605.

Vlogger couple found dead in Kerala, police investigate possible murderA Malayali couple with modest YouTube following was found dead in their home in Parassala, Thiruvananthapuram. The police were looking into a possible murder as they found strangulation marks on the woman's neck.

IIT Roorkee student dances to Taras at college fest. Viral video divides InternetA video of an IIT Roorkee student dancing to Bollywood actor Sharvari's chartbuster Taras at her college fest has gone viral on social media.

Director Rajkumar Periasamy: Amaran is not a war film, it's a slice-of-life dramaDirector Rajkumar Periasamy, in an exclusive chat with India Today Digital, talked about his upcoming film Amaran. The film is a biopic on the life of late Major Mukund Varadarajan.

Salman Khan checks on me every night after father's death: Zeeshan SiddiqueBollywood actor Salman Khan has regularly checked on Zeeshan Siddique following his father Baba Siddique's death. In a recent interview, Zeeshan revealed that Salman was very close to his father.

Exclusive: Seema Sajdeh on Salman Khan's death threatsSeema Sajdeh expressed concern for her children's safety amid threats against Salman Khan, highlighting the impact on their family ties. Seema is a part of Netflix's Fabulous Lives vs Bollywood Wives.

Fan praises Varun Dhawan's kind gesture towards her daughter: What a kind soulActor Varun Dhawan was praised by fans on social media after a woman at the airport thanked him for visiting her sick daughter at the hospital.

sports.headline: Whoever raises voice will get sidelined: Basit Ali on Gary Kirsten's resignationBasit Ali reacted on Gary Kirsten's resignation from his post as the Pakistan team's head coach in white ball cricket. He pointed out that PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi is a powerful man and whosoever will raise their voice will get sidelined.

Erik ten Hag quits as Manchester United manager after West Ham defeatErik ten Hag has left his role as Manchester United manager after the side's unfortunate defeat to West Ham in the Premier League, which has left them only 3 spots away from relegation. United confirmed in their statement that assistant manager, Rudd van Nistelrooy will take over the role.

Mohammad Rizwan calls it 'great honour' to be captain of Pakistan's ODI sideMohammad Rizwan has been appointed Pakistan's new ODI and T20I captain, taking over from Babar Azam after a series of disappointing World Cup performances. Rizwan called it a great honour and understood that it would be a huge responsibility for him.

Ballon d'Or Ceremony: Live streaming, nominees and all you need to knowThe Ballon d'Or 2024 debate intensifies as football's new generation, led by Vinicius Jr, Jude Bellingham, and Rodri, contends for the prestigious award. Each brings a unique blend of club and international success, making this race electrifying.

PM Modi reacts to El Clasico, talks Real Madrid vs Barcelona fandom in IndiaPrime Minister Narendra Modi hailed the rivalry between Real Madrid and FC Barcelona in his latest speech at Vadodra. Speaking about relations between India and Spain. PM Modi said that India also had a massive football culture.

Taijul Islam ready to take Bangladesh Test captaincy if Najmul Shanto quitsBangladesh's seasoned spinner Taijul Islam expresses readiness to assume Test captaincy if Najimul Shanto steps down. Speculations arise as Shanto considers relinquishing the role post South Africa series.

Salima Tete leads revamped Indian team in women's Asian Champions TrophyHockey India has revealed its 18-member women's team for the upcoming Asian Champions Trophy in Bihar. The tournament, featuring six nations, will take place from November 11 to 20.

'Selfless' MS Dhoni reveals reason behind batting at No. 8 for CSK in IPL 2024MS Dhoni revealed that his decision to bat at No. 8 in IPL 2024 was to give teammates like Jadeja and Dube the chance to shine ahead of the T20 World Cup. Despite batting lower, Dhoni thrilled fans with explosive cameos and hinted at an IPL 2025 return.

'Premier batter' Virat Kohli's form a concern before Australia series: MSK PrasadFormer selector MSK Prasad expresses concern over Virat Kohli's Test form as India prepares for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia. Kohli has struggled in the longest format of the game

Virat Kohli will start well in Border-Gavaskar series: Sunil Joshi backs India starSunil Joshi backed Virat Kohli to start off well in the 5-match Test series between Australia and India, starting November 22. Kohli has not been at his best in the ongoing Test series against New Zealand.

My competitive attitude similar to Australia: Harshit Rana on Test call-upHarshit Rana opened up about his competitive attitude being similar to that of the Australians as he earned his maiden Test call-up in the Indian team. The BCCI named India's 18-member squad for the Border Gavaskar series and Harshit is among the 3 uncapped players.

Salima Tete leads revamped Indian team in women's Asian Champions TrophyHockey India has revealed its 18-member women's team for the upcoming Asian Champions Trophy in Bihar. The tournament, featuring six nations, will take place from November 11 to 20.

'Selfless' MS Dhoni reveals reason behind batting at No. 8 for CSK in IPL 2024MS Dhoni revealed that his decision to bat at No. 8 in IPL 2024 was to give teammates like Jadeja and Dube the chance to shine ahead of the T20 World Cup. Despite batting lower, Dhoni thrilled fans with explosive cameos and hinted at an IPL 2025 return.

'Premier batter' Virat Kohli's form a concern before Australia series: MSK PrasadFormer selector MSK Prasad expresses concern over Virat Kohli's Test form as India prepares for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia. Kohli has struggled in the longest format of the game

Virat Kohli will start well in Border-Gavaskar series: Sunil Joshi backs India starSunil Joshi backed Virat Kohli to start off well in the 5-match Test series between Australia and India, starting November 22. Kohli has not been at his best in the ongoing Test series against New Zealand.

My competitive attitude similar to Australia: Harshit Rana on Test call-upHarshit Rana opened up about his competitive attitude being similar to that of the Australians as he earned his maiden Test call-up in the Indian team. The BCCI named India's 18-member squad for the Border Gavaskar series and Harshit is among the 3 uncapped players.

Gary Kirsten resigns as Pakistan white-ball coach 6 months into jobGary Kirsten has resigned as head coach of Pakistan's ODI and T20I teams, mere months after his appointment. The PCB announced Jason Gillespie as the new coach for the upcoming Australia tour.

Pakistan board appoints Jason Gillespie as white-ball coach for Australia tourThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has appointed Jason Gillespie as the white-ball head coach for the team's Australia tour following the acceptance of Gary Kirsten's resignation.

Liverpool boss Arne Slot plays down tag of title contenders after Arsenal drawLiverpool's head coach Arne Slot praised his team's resilience in their 2-2 draw against Arsenal, urging caution on title aspirations despite their strong start. The Reds came from behind twice to secure a point, remaining close contenders in the Premier League race.

Harshit Rana flaunts all-round skills in Ranji after Australia series call-upHarshit Rana flaunts his all-round skills in Delhi's Ranji game against Assam, just days after earning a maiden Test call-up for the Australia series. With a five-wicket haul and a crucial fifty, the 22-year-old justified his place in the squad.

Australia not looking at Inglis as opener for India Test series: George Bailey Australia's chief selector, George Bailey, has confirmed that Josh Inglis will not be considered for the opening role in the upcoming home Test series against India.

Virat Kohli should play domestic cricket, he has disappointed: Dinesh KarthikDinesh Karthik suggested that Virat Kohli should go back to playing domestic cricket as his struggles against spin continues, especially in Test cricket. Kohli just managed 1 and 17 runs in the 2nd Test vs New Zealand.

Red Bull boss Christian Horner coy on Sergio Perez racing beyond Brazilian GPSergio Perez's future with Red Bull Racing is in question after a disappointing performance at the Mexican Grand Prix. Team Principal Christian Horner did not confirm if Perez will finish the season, amidst rumours of changes in the lineup.

Unfair to question Rohit Sharma after New Zealand series loss: Shikhar DhawanFormer opener Shikhar Dhawan, while speaking to IndiaToday.in has backed Rohit Sharma, saying that it is unfair to judge the Indian captain after just one Test series loss to New Zealand. Dhawan said that captaincy is not just about wins or losses.

Australia not looking at Inglis as opener for India Test series: George Bailey Australia's chief selector, George Bailey, has confirmed that Josh Inglis will not be considered for the opening role in the upcoming home Test series against India.

Virat Kohli should play domestic cricket, he has disappointed: Dinesh KarthikDinesh Karthik suggested that Virat Kohli should go back to playing domestic cricket as his struggles against spin continues, especially in Test cricket. Kohli just managed 1 and 17 runs in the 2nd Test vs New Zealand.

Red Bull boss Christian Horner coy on Sergio Perez racing beyond Brazilian GPSergio Perez's future with Red Bull Racing is in question after a disappointing performance at the Mexican Grand Prix. Team Principal Christian Horner did not confirm if Perez will finish the season, amidst rumours of changes in the lineup.

Unfair to question Rohit Sharma after New Zealand series loss: Shikhar DhawanFormer opener Shikhar Dhawan, while speaking to IndiaToday.in has backed Rohit Sharma, saying that it is unfair to judge the Indian captain after just one Test series loss to New Zealand. Dhawan said that captaincy is not just about wins or losses.

IPL Retention Buzz Live: Dhoni to play 2025 season, Shreyas to remain in KKR?IPL Retention Build-up Highlights: The retention date is fast approaching with all the 10 IPL teams set to make some big calls. MS Dhoni playing in the new season and Shreyas Iyer remaining at KKR are hot topics of discussion at the moment.

MotoGP championship leader Jorge Martin uses Ganesha-inspired helmet for Thai GPJorge Martin paid tribute to Lord Ganesha with a special helmet at the Thai GP, where he finished second after a fierce contest with Francesco Bagnaia.

Carlos Sainz wins Mexico GP as Max Verstappen gets penalised twiceCarlos Sainz secured a landmark victory at the Mexico City Grand Prix, delivering Ferrari's first win at the track since 1990. Max Verstappen faced penalties, reducing his championship lead as Lando Norris and Charles Leclerc completed the podium.

Chirag Chikkara wins gold in U23 World Wrestling ChampionshipsIndia's Chirag Chikkara became only the second Indian male wrestler to win Gold in the 57kg category at the U23 World Championships on Sunday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
